event.title: 1024–66), the manor (i.e. the land) of "Estone" was held

data.event: During the reign of Edward the Confessor (1024–66), the manor (i.e. the land) of "Estone" was held by three vassals of Stigend, Archbishop of Canterbury.
By the time Domesday Book was completed (1086), the small community of Estone, now Aston, was made up of about twenty-five families and included a priest.
